history.content: Be aware that EECS 126 and 127 are not official prerequisites, only suggestions from Prof. Sahai. They're both more about developing modes of thinking rather than teaching specific topics that will be required for 189. If you feel that your math background is strong and that you feel good about CS 70, 189 right now is fine. To answer your question, I took 189 along with 170, 61C, and a breadth and wasn't overloaded, even taking it with Sahai and his 15-20 hr weekly homeworks. (I also hadn't taken 126/127 either).

Be aware that EECS 126 and 127 are not official prerequisites, only suggestions from Prof. Sahai. They're both more about developing modes of thinking rather than teaching specific topics that will be required for 189. If you feel that your math background is strong and that you feel good about CS 70, 189 right now is fine. To answer your question, I took 189 along with 170, 61C, and a breadth and felt it was fine. (I also hadn't taken 126/127 either).

Certainly for anyone who was planning on taking 170 in their last semester, it is pretty clear that they should take 126 before taking 189. 

Probability (126) and Optimization (127) aren't prerequisites for machine learning (189) because somebody said so, they are prerequisites because of the nature of machine learning itself. If you want to understand machine learning *properly*, you need to internalize probability and optimization at a deeper level. Otherwise, you risk learning a shoddy "machine learning algorithms" course instead of machine learning.

Hi All,

I am in the first semester of my senior year. A while ago when I did my course planning I was very set on taking CS 189 in this current semester. However I didnt realize until now that since I created this plan the prerequisites for this class have changed to include EECS 126 and 127. I took Math 110 and I feel confident in my linear algebra, however my only experience with probability was with CS70. I think it would be best for me to take 126 this semester and take 189 in Spring to better prepare. I was planning on taking CS 170 in Spring 2019. I know that taking both of these courses at once is not recommended, however there is a rule that allows seniors in their last semester to have a reduced course-load if they need less than 13 units to complete their requirements, so I would be able to take 170 and 189 with no other classes. I would really like to take both classes since they are both applicable to what I would like to study in graduate school. I would really appreciate any input from other students who have taken these courses if they think this plan would be manageable. 

Thanks
history.subject: Taking 189 and 170 in the same Semester (with no other classes)
